column1: #text=Last year when I worked for a friend doing landscaping jobs , we often had to plant trees .
#text=Generally , we would choose a tree from a near by plant store based on what our customer desired .
#text=Trees can be purchased at all different ages , from very small to the size of a large pot .
#text=Then , after buying the tree or trees , we would purchase mulch , or fertilizer , to give the tree the proper nutrients so it can grow big and strong .
#text=After the tree and fertilizer is purchased , we were off the house to perform our various activities .
#text=We lived in a desert environment , so we first had to push all the rocks out of the way with either a rake , a hoe , or one of our other tools .
#text=After clearing the area in the yard for the tree , we then took our shovels and started digging away in the area chosen to plant the tree .
#text=We had to dig our hole big enough so that the entire bottom of the tree with roots and dirt fits snugly into the ground .
#text=After that is done , we would fill the hole with a mixture of mulch and the dirt we pulled up when we first shoveled our hole open .
#text=After the tree has been firmly planted , we either had to turn on the sprinklers in the lawn , or find the nearest hose and water the plants for about five to ten minutes .
